post.body: it was item #1 on my to-do list this am. :)
Day 1 of the nanny's 2-wk vacation. Trying to plan activities for each day. Wish me luck.
now that the leaves are gone from the willow trees outside my office window, i can see 494. Slow-going right now. Weird for the noon hour.
just noticed "smurf christmas" is on a random cable channel right now. DVR'ing it for the 4YO. This is one of those weekends w/o a TV max.
4YO's swimming lesson worth leaving the house for this am? Remembering the drive-thru starbucks across street from pool = YES.
Wondering why/how we can be out of coffee at the house during a blizzard?
enough thinking about work. time for a holiday-inspired drink in front of the xmas tree. something with baileys, maybe?
thinking about the great work done this week. very tricky IA scenarios. clients trying new things. I'm so proud of my team and my clients!
Hey, if there can be an un-summit, maybe we should start an old-school-mima. Who's with me?
I'm sure the mima party is rockin' right now, but J and I decided to skip it. 300 rsvps? I miss old-school mima, when 50 was a big event.
Just received very pretty flowers from @halvorson and friends. Thanks brain traffic! http://twitpic.com/tpc9
Welcome to the twitterverse, @beth_mueller!
just downloaded my first Kanye West song, thanks to SNL. now i'm even MORE musically diverse http://tinyurl.com/6ro3be
Planning a day of IA today. Great project. Great client. Great team. Great day! Thanks for making my job possible, EG clients.
but in the meantime, like watching your kid on the soccer field when he's still learning the skills, it can be hard. exciting, but hard.
old companies are great. i love helping them. they're like a child learning a new sport. they'll get there, they just have to learn skills.
did yesterday's tweet sound negative? 140 is hard. my point is, i get excited about the potential for a client because i love them!
Man it's hard to get out to the gym when it's -9
Enjoying "1st Wave" on Sirius radio. Howard Jones, Pet Shop Boys.
: though I'm sure being a consultant to an 80YO co. isn't as hard as being an employee (our client) in charge of interactive communications.
